title: I voted Remain, but it’s time for business leaders to back Boris
text:
Much as it may surprise some people, I voted Remain in 2016. After a lot of thought I concluded that the process of leaving the European Union would be so painful, unpleasant and divisive that we were better off staying in and trying to use our influence to reform its broken, bureaucratic institutions.

However difficult I imagined the journey would be, the reality of course has been far worse. The European Union has set out to make our departure from its cosy club as difficult and unpleasant as possible – and my how it has succeeded.

It has been unwittingly assisted for much of the time by a weak and uncertain British Prime Minister whose inability to lead or build any consensus steadily strengthened...
description: Much as it may surprise some people, I voted Remain in 2016.
